subject: p16662264
History: -year-old female patient with diabetes mellitus, patient with multifocal pneumonia and now increased tightness in chest. Wish to make sure that infection not worse as improvement is slowed with shortness of breath with minimal exertion. Antibiotic therapy completed. No fever.
Findings: PA and lateral chest views were obtained with patient in upright position. Comparison is made with the next preceding similar study of. The heart size remains unchanged and is within normal limits. Unremarkable position of previously described left-sided PICC line terminating in mid portion of SVC. The pulmonary vasculature is not congested and no pneumothorax can be identified. On previous examinations remaining multifocal density have generally improved. In particular, a lesion identified on the last examination overlying the right upper lobe area laterally third right intercostal space has cleared up almost completely. Densities located in the right middle lobe as well as those seen in the left upper lobe lingula persist, but have also undergone a slight improvement. Again, no pneumothorax has developed, no new infiltrates are seen and the lateral and posterior pleural sinuses remain free from any pleural effusion.
Impression: Improvement of multifocal infiltrates but persistent densities in right middle lobe and peripheral lingula. Further followup examination must be guided by patients symptomatology.
